results.content:
The course attempts to get students to follow along and copy code to create two basic web applications.  You absolutely need to have a good level of C# and SQL experience before tackling this course.  It is a semi-beginner's course to ASP.NET, but it is also a difficult course to follow particularly for the 2nd application.

Both courses suffer from poor delivery of their explainations of ASP.NET concepts, although at least for the first, and easier application, you do have challenges to test out what you have learnt.  I hate the fact that in the 2nd part of the course, there is never an overview/rerun of what code was put in and why. 
 Overall, I came away bitterly disappointed with the content provided and felt I had learnt next to nothing as the focus was mostly on getting to create the two web applications as quick as humanely possible.

This course may be more suitable for those who have done ASP.NET before, and are looking for a refresher course.

If you must, I advise all to give purchase the course, but be absolutely wary that you may find the content and course delivery extremely lacking and frustrating, but do go through as many of the videos, up to the 2nd half of the course asap to decide if this is worth it to you.
results.content_html:
The course attempts to get students to follow along and copy code to create two basic web applications. You absolutely need to have a good level of C# and SQL experience before tackling this course. It is a semi-beginner's course to ASP.NET, but it is also a difficult course to follow particularly for the 2nd application.

Both courses suffer from poor delivery of their explainations of ASP.NET concepts, although at least for the first, and easier application, you do have challenges to test out what you have learnt. I hate the fact that in the 2nd part of the course, there is never an overview/rerun of what code was put in and why.
Overall, I came away bitterly disappointed with the content provided and felt I had learnt next to nothing as the focus was mostly on getting to create the two web applications as quick as humanely possible.

This course may be more suitable for those who have done ASP.NET before, and are looking for a refresher course.

If you must, I advise all to give purchase the course, but be absolutely wary that you may find the content and course delivery extremely lacking and frustrating, but do go through as many of the videos, up to the 2nd half of the course asap to decide if this is worth it to you.

results.content_html: I would have rated the first part with Denis 5 stars, but the second part of not a course at all. It's just a guide how to copy paste to get an appointment app.

results.content:
There are many parts where code just shows up without really knowing why that is being done.

There are things done in  early videos with no idea about why, until almost the end of the training.

I would be good not to make some mistakes and then go back and correct them, since the trainee can get lost.

At some point it was clear to me JavaScript clear understanding is 100% necessary.

Would I recommend this course? YES, but not to very junior people wanting to go to PRO, since some topics are not for junior at all. So if you are junior on several topics, it is important you know you have to do "your homework" to understand several items through out the course. Overall, a very good course, just watch out your level Vs the expectations.

results.content:
SKIP THIS COURSE.  First instructor was better than second.  Both instructors had you start a new project, therefore throwing away the previous code you worked on instead of just building on it.  The naming style of files were different between the instructors.  Second instructor just typed fast and you couldn't keep up.  Sound recording was bad and 
 Keyboard echoing.  I would have rated this higher had it just been the first instructor.   The second instructor needs to redo the entire videos. 
 Slow down and not rush the code.  Issues with folder names, C# property lower camel case names. 
 In spots he "speeds up the typing" .   I would recommend another course because this was too inconsistent.
results.content_html:
SKIP THIS COURSE. First instructor was better than second. Both instructors had you start a new project, therefore throwing away the previous code you worked on instead of just building on it. The naming style of files were different between the instructors. Second instructor just typed fast and you couldn't keep up. Sound recording was bad and
Keyboard echoing. I would have rated this higher had it just been the first instructor. The second instructor needs to redo the entire videos.
Slow down and not rush the code. Issues with folder names, C# property lower camel case names.
In spots he "speeds up the typing" . I would recommend another course because this was too inconsistent.

results.content:
I really like how Denis repeats his actions to "drive home" the topic he is talking about.  For ME, this helps a lot!  Although I like to get in and just start messing around with code, I need to learn what I am doing first.  Denis is doing a great job teaching the fundamentals, the lingo and why things work they way they work.  I need to know this kind of stuff instead of just jumping head first in, not knowing why I'm doing this, or why this file is needed etc.
I'm onto the following sections creating the "AppointmentScheduling" webapp.  The instructor here, although very thorough and easy to understand, has a different teaching style which is much different from Denis.  Personally, I would have rather had Denis continue on.  But, for the sake of completing this course and getting my completion certification, I will continue on.  It would have been nice if this was mentioned before I purchased the training.  If it was mentioned, I missed it.
results.content_html:

results.content:
While you MAY not read this post, but I feel the need to tell you.
After starting to watch the video on YouTube (Top Course - Learn ASP.NET Core 5.0 MVC - CRUD Operations, EntityFramework Core), I fell in love with your teaching style. That was absolutely the best learning tool that I have ever had. After clicking on the link to get your course, I saw that it was offered for only $20.00. For me, that was a no brainer for me to purchase. That is less expensive than books that I purchase to not learn anything.
Right now, I am skipping through what I have already seen on YouTube and so excited to get started with the course. 
Personally, I am very excited to see what other technologies (Blazor) you will be teaching. (I have not gotten an opportunity to look at your site yet.) I am also interested in using MVC to develop a (good looking) responsive website using free templates and integrating SqlDependency into a website and API’s

I am very excited so far with this course and THANK YOU for your time.

results.content: First of all the Instructors are very good. The lesson splits in two parts. I put 3.5 because at the second part the lesson is more about javascript than mvc and it skips critical mvc  parts like areas. Additionally at Section 11 where it is about Azure Deployment the lesson is 7 minutes about azure deployment (it skips critical details) and 11 minutes about the self advertised myWindowsHosting deployment. Not that you are not going to learn but i expected what the title says.
results.content_html: First of all the Instructors are very good. The lesson splits in two parts. I put 3.5 because at the second part the lesson is more about javascript than mvc and it skips critical mvc parts like areas. Additionally at Section 11 where it is about Azure Deployment the lesson is 7 minutes about azure deployment (it skips critical details) and 11 minutes about the self advertised myWindowsHosting deployment. Not that you are not going to learn but i expected what the title says.
